instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing one slot of RAM
threads.message: Hi, I have this board which doesnÂ´t recognize the lower slot for the ram... is there anything that can be done to repair that? I have tried both dimms in the upper slot and they both work fine.... thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Missing one slot of RAM
threads.message:
Usually cracked solders near the edges of the slot.
You can use a RAM card tester and see which LEDs stay off; then follow the lines in schematic/boardview.
